DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection And Preservation Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Variation Comments Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text description of comments/issues regarding storage/preservation or deviation from SOP.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection And Preservation Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Variation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact._A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Collection And Preservation Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Standard Operating Procedure Variation
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.:A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.:An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The activity of protecting something from loss or danger; a process that saves organic substances from decay; to maintain or keep intact.

A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.
An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field for general notes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
